newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Inmates seize hostages at Brazil's largest jail.
newsitem.headline: Inmates seize hostages at Brazil's largest jail.

text.p: Inmates at Latin America's largest prison seized about a dozen guards on Wednesday and demanded transfers to other facilities, officials said.

Celso Otavio, an aide to the director of Brazil's notorious Carandiru prison, told Reuters between 18 and 20 prisoners wielding utility blades took "more than 10" guards hostage in the prison's Pavilion No. 4.
"No one's been injured. They're negotiating right now," he said. "The prisoners want to be transferred."
Carandiru, which houses 6,400 prisoners, was the site of a massacre by military police of 111 rioting inmates in 1992.

The hostage-taking was the latest in a spate of rebellions this year at overcrowded Brazilian prisons and took place a day after inmates at a jail outside Sao Paulo ended a three-day uprising that left two prisoners dead.
On Tuesday, inmates at the Ferraz de Vasconcelos jail laid down knives and other homemade weapons and freed their last 10 hostages, including an eight-month-old baby and three-year-old child.
